business.headline: Stock market bounces back, but will the relief rally last?Overall, the situation on Dalal Street looks much better than how it appeared at the beginning of last week. Does this mean investors can take it easy now?

EPFO announces new rules for EDLI Scheme: 3 key death benefits updatesThe EDLI scheme is part of the Employees' Provident Fund (EPF) and acts as a social security benefit, offering financial assistance to the dependents of an EPF member in the event of the untimely death of the EPF member while still employed.
Why are Tata Power shares rising today? Details here Tata Power stock has had a mixed run. The stock is down 20% in the past six months but has still gained 67% over the past two years.

Gensol Engineering shares crash 40% in a week. Why is it falling today?Gensol Engineering stock price: The shares of the company were down 3.99% to Rs 309.05 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) at 10:24 am. In early trade, the company's shares were trading even lower.

Explained: Why IndusInd Bank shares fell over 5% in early tradeIndusInd Bank share price: The sell-off came after the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) gave CEO Sumant Kathpalia a one-year extension instead of the three-year term the board had wanted.

Sensex gains 400 points: 3 reasons why stock market is rising todaySensex opened at 74,474.98, slightly higher than its previous close of 74,332.58. The index quickly gained over 350 points, reaching the day's high of 74,713.17.
Sensex, Nifty open higher as US Fed comments ease worries; IndusInd down 5%The S&P BSE Sensex gained 114.62 points to 74,447.20, while the NSE Nifty50 added 42.25 points to 22,597.75 as of 9:25 AM.
Stock market today: What to expect from Sensex and Nifty? The Nifty ended at 22,552.50, while the Sensex closed at 74,332.58 in the last session, both gaining nearly 2% for the week.
Stocks to watch today: ONGC, HCLTech, IndusInd Bank, Tata PowerInvestors are expected to remain cautious due to uncertainty over US tariff threats and global market reactions.

Why family offices are crucial to India's 'Viksit Bharat by 2047' dream?At the India Today Conclave 2025, Rishabh Shroff, Partner at Cyril Amarchand Mangaldas, discussed the growing role of family offices in India's journey towards becoming a developed economy by 2047. In a session titled "A Case for Tomorrow", moderated by Siddharth Zarabi, Shroff explained why family offices are vital for India's economic expansion and how they can contribute to achieving a Rs 30 trillion GDP target in the coming decades.

US Gold Card visa expensive, not worth it for Indians: Top law firm bossRishabh Shroff, partner at Cyril Amarchand Mangaldas, said Donald Trump's $5 million US Gold Card visa does not make sense for Indians as cheaper alternatives are available.

Why are the richest 1% leaving India? Law firm boss Rishabh Shroff explains Rishabh Shroff, Partner at Cyril Amarchand Mangaldas, shared insights into the rising trend of high-net-worth individuals (HNWIs) acquiring foreign passports and moving their wealth abroad.

entertainment.headline: Suits LA: Harvey Spector lands on the West Coast, throws some sass at Ted BlackIn the new promo of 'Suits LA', Harvey Spector is finally seen interacting with Ted Black. Actor Gabriel Macht will be joining the show for a three-episode arc.

Exclusive: How Shawn Mendes collaborated with Indian sitarist for Lolla India setSinger Shawn Mendes collaborated with sitarist Megha Rawoot for Day 1 for Lollapalooza India. In an exclusive interview with Megha Rawoot, she spoke about her performance.

Kodava protection body wants security for Rashmika Mandanna after MLA's remarkThe Codava National Council urged authorities to provide security for actor Rashmika Mandanna. According to the Kodava rights' body, the actor was being unfairly targeted after Congress MLA Ravi Ganiga claimed she refused to attend a Kannada film industry event.

Shankar Mahadevan remembers 'guiding light' Zakir Hussain on birth anniversaryIt was legendary tabla maestro Zakir Hussain's 74th birth anniversary on Sunday. Marking the occasion, singer and composer Shankar Mahadevan honoured him with heartfelt birthday wishes on social media.

Lady Gaga recalls psychosis diagnosis and how she felt 'ashamed' to talk about itIn an interview, singer Lady Gaga discussed her personal struggles that kept her away from music. She shared insights into her mental health journey, being diagnosed with psychosis and the support from her partner, Michael Polansky.

The Last of Us 2 trailer: Pedro Pascal and Bella Ramsey promise thrilling returnThe first full trailer of The Last of Us Season 2 is here. Starring Pedro Pascal and Bella Ramsey in lead roles, the HBO Max series promises a bigger and better season.

Lollapalooza India Day 1: Shawn Mendes must return for a solo concert in IndiaThe first day of Lollapalooza India 2025 kicked off on a grand note with Canadian singer Shawn Mendes' electrifying performance. The show also witnessed performances by several Indian artists, like Jonita Gandhi and Divine among others.

Shawn Mendes honours Virat Kohli, wears Team India jersey at Mumbai show. WatchSinger Shawn Mendes impressed fans with his debut India performance on March 8 at the Lollapalooza Mumbai show. During the concert, the singer delighted fans by wearing Virat Kohli's Team India jersey.

Viral: Shawn Mendes sings Senorita on Mumbai street ahead of concertCanadian singer Shawn Mendes, who is currently in India, performed his hit song Senorita on a Mumbai street on Saturday, much to the delight of his fans.
Zahan Kapoor on legacy, Black Warrant, and carving his own path. Watch

Zahan Kapoor reflects on celebrityhood, Kapoor legacy and Black Warrant's successActor Zahan Kapoor opened up about his career, his latest Netflix show, Black Warrant, his famous cousins, and more, at the India Today Conclave 2025 held in New Delhi on Saturday.

Mindy Kaling reacts to criticism of Meghan Markle's With Love, MeghanActor and creator Mindy Kaling has finally reacted to the criticism of Meghan Markle's lifestyle series, With Love, Meghan. The show premiered on Netflix on March 4.

general news.headline: Air India flight to New York returns to Mumbai due to mid-air security threat, checks underwayAir India flight to New York returns to Mumbai due to mid-air security threat, checks underway

Vanuatu moves to cancel fugitive Lalit Modi's passport: Bid to avoid extraditionVanuatu Prime Minister Jotham Napat accused the fugitive businessman and ex-IPL chief Lalit Modi of using the island nation's citizenship to evade extradition.

Lok Sabha resumes amid uproar over education policy, BJP calls DMK 'dishonest'  Live UpdatesThe government and Opposition engaged in a heated clash as Parliament's Budget session resumed today, with key battles over electoral roll irregularities, National Education Policy (NEP), Manipur violence, the Waqf Bill and delimitation.

Rohit Sharma's X-rated message to critics: Virat Kohli and I are not retiringRohit Sharma had some choice words for his critics as he announced that he and Virat Kohli won't be retiring from ODIs just yet after India's Champions Trophy win on Sunday, March 9. India defeated New Zealand in Dubai to win their third Champions Trophy title.

Meet Trudeau's successor Mark Carney, who once likened Trump to VoldemortOn Sunday, Mark Carney was elected as Justin Trudeau's successor after Liberal Party members voted in a nominating contest. Trudeau resigned in January, months after facing a stiff internal revolt with demands for him to step down.

International drug trafficker wanted by FBI caught by Punjab PoliceThe Tarn Taran Police announced through social media that they had arrested a transnational drug lord wanted by the Federal Bureau of Investigation. Identified as Shehnaz Singh, aka Shawn Bhinder, he reportedly smuggled cocaine from Colombia to the United States and Canada.

Foretold, feared, fulfilled; but final should have been played in LahoreIndia's Champions Trophy win was like a war never fought but already won. With a team as relentless as Sparta's 300 and a batting lineup that rose like demons from every fallen wicket, this victory was never in doubt -- only a story waiting to be told.

Air India flight makes emergency U-turn after clogged toilets cause 10-hour chaosThe airline, however, said that the flight made a U-turn after being airborne for more than five hours due to a technical issue.

Exclusive: How Shawn Mendes collaborated with Indian sitarist for Lolla India setSinger Shawn Mendes collaborated with sitarist Megha Rawoot for Day 1 for Lollapalooza India. In an exclusive interview with Megha Rawoot, she spoke about her performance.

Zelenskyy took money from Biden like 'candy from a baby', quips TrumpWeeks after the epic Oval Office meltdown between the two presidents, Donald Trump has once again suggested that Volodymyr Zelenskyy was not grateful for American aid.

Two teens go missing in J&K's Kathua days after 3 locals found dead Days after three locals were found dead, two teenagers — Mohammad Din and Rehman Ali — have gone missing in Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua district, raising fresh concerns over the security situation.

IIM graduate quits Rs 21 LPA job in 10 days after realising role involves salesIn a post titled "Funny incident of an IIM grad", a Reddit user narrated the particular incident involving the IIM graduate, which has triggered a debate on social media.

IIFA Awards 2025: Laapataa Ladies, Kill and Kartik Aaryan bag top honoursDirector Kiran Rao's Laapataa Ladies, Kill, Kartik Aaryan and several others won big at the IIFA 2025. The award ceremony took place in Jaipur on March 9.

Indian-origin student in US vanishes on trip to Dominican Republic, search onSudiksha Konanki, a 20-year-old student from the University of Pittsburgh, was last seen on March 6 on the beach of the Riu Republica Hotel in Punta Cana, according to authorities in the Dominican Republic.

Clashes at rally in Mhow after India's win; vehicles set on fire, stones thrownA rally celebrating India's win was passing through the Jama Masjid area in Mhow when some individuals from the vicinity started throwing stones at them.

Kodava protection body wants security for Rashmika Mandanna after MLA's remarkThe Codava National Council urged authorities to provide security for actor Rashmika Mandanna. According to the Kodava rights' body, the actor was being unfairly targeted after Congress MLA Ravi Ganiga claimed she refused to attend a Kannada film industry event.

Watch: Man's 'zero civic sense rant' about fellow Indian talking loudly at airportDespite multiple requests from the bartender to lower his volume, the man continued speaking loudly on the phone in the lounge of the Abu Dhabi airport.

Why Pakistan representatives were missing from Champions Trophy closing ceremonyThe reason why there were no Pakistan representatives at the Champions Trophy closing ceremony has been revealed as an ICC spokesperson spoke to India Today about the situation. The absence of PCB officials at the closing ceremony created a lot of backlash, with Shoaib Akhtar being one of the people voicing his displeasure.

Fashion show in Gulmarg during Ramzan sparks row, Omar Abdullah vows actionJammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah ordered an inquiry after a controversy arose over an outdoor fashion show being held in Gulmarg, a popular tourist attraction, during the holy month of Ramzan.

Devendra Fadnavis backs calls for Aurangzeb's tomb removal with jab at CongressThis comes a week after Samajwadi Party's Abu Azmi sparked controversy by praising Mughal emperor Aurangzeb. He claimed that Aurangzeb had built temples and was not a cruel emperor.

Kareena dances to Mera Joota Hai Japani at IIFA 2025, honours Raj Kapoor's legacyKareena Kapoor Khan paid tribute to her late grandfather, actor Raj Kapoor, at IIFA 2025. She danced to his classic songs, and fans loved her performance, wishing Karisma and Ranbir Kapoor had joined her.

Ranya Rao's firm allotted land during BJP reign: Karnataka industrial bodyCongress government and the Karnataka Industrial Area Development Board admitted that a firm associated with Ranya Rao was allotted land in Tumakuru district. However, the KIADB clarified that it was done during the previous BJP government.
Video: UP cop holds upside-down Indian flag to disperse crowd, clashes eruptPolice were called to disperse the crowd as traffic came to a standstill on the busy road due to the massive crowd.

Undisputed again? Rohit Sharma restores India's golden era in white-ball cricketRohit Sharma has spearheaded India's resurgence in white-ball cricket, leading them to back-to-back ICC titles and restoring their golden era. With no plans to retire soon, Rohit has now sets his sights on eclipsing MS Dhoni's legacy.

Actor Yash attends politician Tejasvi Surya's wedding, congratulates him. WatchActor Yash was seen attending the wedding of Indian politician Tejasvi Surya. A video of their interaction is gaining attention online.

Dragon tops Rs 100 crore gross, beats Vidaamuyarchi as biggest box office surprise'Dragon', starring Pradeep Ranganathan and Anupama Parameswaran in the lead, has emerged as the highest-grossing Tamil film of the year. The film has gone past the lifetime domestic gross of Ajith's 'Vidaamuyarchi'.

Mahesh Babu, Prithviraj's clip from SSMB 29 leaked, makers take strict actionA leaked clip from SSMB 29 shows Mahesh Babu in a rugged look, confronting Prithviraj Sukumaran's character. However, the makers are actively working to remove the unauthorised footage.

Shankar Mahadevan remembers 'guiding light' Zakir Hussain on birth anniversaryIt was legendary tabla maestro Zakir Hussain's 74th birth anniversary on Sunday. Marking the occasion, singer and composer Shankar Mahadevan honoured him with heartfelt birthday wishes on social media.

The absence of PCB officials at the closing ceremony created a lot of backlash, with Shoaib Akhtar being one of the people voicing his displeasure.

Learn art of overcoming obstacles: Gautam Gambhir stuns Sidhu with poemThe usually serious Gautam Gambhir decided to stun Navjot Singh Sidhu with a few lines from a poem after India's Champions Trophy win on Sunday, March 9. India defeated New Zealand to win the final.

New Zealand wanted to win Champions Trophy final for Matt Henry: Mitchell SantnerNew Zealand skipper Mitchell Santner said that the team was looking to win the Champions Trophy final against India for the injured Matt Henry. The pacer missed the summit clash due to an injury and was left in tears ahead of the game on Sunday.

Champions Trophy victory proves why Gambhir is right man for white-ball jobGautam Gambhir secured his first ICC title as the India head coach on Sunday, March 9. After his title win, Gambhir stayed away from the limelight, making sure that he did not take the focus away from the players who had played near flawless cricket to secure the trophy.

IND vs NZ: Rohit Sharma's approach puts fear in bowlers, says Mitchell SantnerNew Zealand captain Mitchell Santner praised Rohit Sharma for his performance in the final of the Champions Trophy 2025. Rohit's 76 set up the thrilling chase for India on Sunday, March 9 in Dubai against the Blackcaps.

New Zealand is a very clinical team, satisfying to beat them: Rohit Sharma Champions Trophy 2025: Indian captain Rohit Sharma said that New Zealand is a very clinical team, and it was satisfying to beat them in the final on Sunday at the Dubai International Cricket Stadium.

'Silent hero' Shreyas Iyer was brilliant: Rohit Sharma credits India batterChampions Trophy 2025: Rohit Sharma praised Shreyas Iyer for showing consistency and helping India win the title with a four-wicket win over New Zealand in the final in Dubai on Sunday.

Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli surpass MS Dhoni: Champions Trophy triumph in numbersChampions Trophy final: India defeated New Zealand on Sunday in the final to become the most-successful team in the tournament's history. Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli won their fourth ICC title, eclipsing MS Dhoni.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
